meanings.definition: The amount that a shovel can hold at one time.
meanings.sent1: He filled the hole with shovelfuls of dirt.
meanings.sent2: The gardener used shovelfuls of soil to plant the flowers.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a shovelfuls race to see who could move the most dirt.
meanings.sent4: She shoveled shovelfuls of snow from the driveway.
meanings.sent5: The farmer loaded shovelfuls of grain into the truck.

meanings.sent1: They needed many shovelfuls to finish the job.
meanings.sent2: The workers carried shovelfuls of sand to the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The team won the competition by collecting the most shovelfuls.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners filled the wheelbarrow with shovelfuls of compost.
meanings.sent5: The children played in the sandbox, filling buckets with shovelfuls of sand.
